questions.text: You notice the below shown instrument being used in the Gyn OT. Which surgery would this instrument be used in?
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The image shows a Uterine manipulator (Mangeshikar type) It is used to assist movements of the uterus in laparoscopic surgeries, particularly in laparoscopic hysterectomies. They are beneficial in improving visualization and providing a landmark for the colpotomy during hysterectomy. They also help in other laparoscopic surgeries as they can manipulate the uterus and assist the surgeon during different laparoscopic pelvic surgeries.
  • ➤ The image shows a Uterine manipulator (Mangeshikar type)
  • ➤ It is used to assist movements of the uterus in laparoscopic surgeries, particularly in laparoscopic hysterectomies.
  • ➤ They are beneficial in improving visualization and providing a landmark for the colpotomy during hysterectomy.
  • ➤ They also help in other laparoscopic surgeries as they can manipulate the uterus and assist the surgeon during different laparoscopic pelvic surgeries.

questions.text: A 36-year lady presents with menorrhagia. On evaluation she is found to have a large intramural fibroid. A myomectomy is planned. All are beneficial in reducing blood loss during surgery except?

options.label: C
options.text: Ligation of vessels over the surface of the myoma

options.label: D
options.text: Use of vasopressin along the planned serosal incision

questions.correct_answer: C. Ligation of vessels over the surface of the myoma
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Myomectomy is a conservative surgery for fibroid uterus It can be performed via laparotomy or laparoscopically Risk of bleeding. This can be reduced Preoperatively GnRH agonists: They also reduce the size of the fibroid Correction of anemia/ blood transfusion Uterine Artery Embolization Intra-operatively Use of Bonney’s uterine clamp/ uterine tourniquet (tied at the level of the uterine arteries) Use of vasopressin: injected along the planned serosal incision
  • ➤ Myomectomy is a conservative surgery for fibroid uterus It can be performed via laparotomy or laparoscopically Risk of bleeding. This can be reduced Preoperatively GnRH agonists: They also reduce the size of the fibroid Correction of anemia/ blood transfusion Uterine Artery Embolization Intra-operatively Use of Bonney’s uterine clamp/ uterine tourniquet (tied at the level of the uterine arteries) Use of vasopressin: injected along the planned serosal incision
  • ➤ It can be performed via laparotomy or laparoscopically Risk of bleeding. This can be reduced Preoperatively GnRH agonists: They also reduce the size of the fibroid Correction of anemia/ blood transfusion Uterine Artery Embolization Intra-operatively Use of Bonney’s uterine clamp/ uterine tourniquet (tied at the level of the uterine arteries) Use of vasopressin: injected along the planned serosal incision
  • ➤ It can be performed via laparotomy or laparoscopically
  • ➤ Risk of bleeding. This can be reduced Preoperatively GnRH agonists: They also reduce the size of the fibroid Correction of anemia/ blood transfusion Uterine Artery Embolization Intra-operatively Use of Bonney’s uterine clamp/ uterine tourniquet (tied at the level of the uterine arteries) Use of vasopressin: injected along the planned serosal incision
  • ➤ Preoperatively GnRH agonists: They also reduce the size of the fibroid Correction of anemia/ blood transfusion Uterine Artery Embolization Intra-operatively Use of Bonney’s uterine clamp/ uterine tourniquet (tied at the level of the uterine arteries) Use of vasopressin: injected along the planned serosal incision
  • ➤ Preoperatively GnRH agonists: They also reduce the size of the fibroid Correction of anemia/ blood transfusion Uterine Artery Embolization
  • ➤ GnRH agonists: They also reduce the size of the fibroid Correction of anemia/ blood transfusion Uterine Artery Embolization
  • ➤ GnRH agonists: They also reduce the size of the fibroid
  • ➤ Correction of anemia/ blood transfusion
  • ➤ Uterine Artery Embolization
  • ➤ Intra-operatively Use of Bonney’s uterine clamp/ uterine tourniquet (tied at the level of the uterine arteries) Use of vasopressin: injected along the planned serosal incision

questions.text: A 44 year old woman undergoes dilation and curettage for abnormal uterine bleeding. Identify this instrument used in the procedure.
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ This is an image of a uterine curette It is used for curetting the endometrium in the following procedures Dilatation and curettage Following suction evacuation in MTP It has a sharp end (used in gyn procedures) and a blunt end (used in obstetric procedures)

  • ➤ It is used for curetting the endometrium in the following procedures Dilatation and curettage Following suction evacuation in MTP

questions.text: A 48y woman undergoes a diagnostic dilatation and curettage for abnormal uterine bleeding. Which of the following instruments listed below are used in her dilatation and curettage? Uterine curette Ovum forceps Sim’s speculum Punch biopsy forceps Artery forceps Vulsellum Hegar dilators Babcock forceps
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A dilatation and curettage (D & C) is indicated in diagnosing endometrial pathology in abnormal uterine bleeding.
  • ➤ The following instruments are used:
  • ➤ Sponge holding forceps/ ring forceps to paint the prepared area Sim’s speculum and anterior vaginal wall retractor to visualize the cervix Vulsellum or tenaculum to hold the anterior cervical lip Uterine sound to measure the uterine length Hegar dilators to dilate the cervix Uterine curette to curette the endometrium
  • ➤ Sponge holding forceps/ ring forceps to paint the prepared area
  • ➤ Sim’s speculum and anterior vaginal wall retractor to visualize the cervix
  • ➤ Vulsellum or tenaculum to hold the anterior cervical lip
  • ➤ Uterine sound to measure the uterine length
  • ➤ Hegar dilators to dilate the cervix
  • ➤ Uterine curette to curette the endometrium
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 486, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology, 7 th edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 486, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology, 7 th edition

questions.text: A 66y lady presents with postmenopausal bleeding. On speculum examination, a growth is seen on the cervix as shown. Which instrument should be used to take a biopsy of the growth?
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Whenever there is a cervical grwthm to confirm the diagnosis, a biopsy is taken using a punch biopsy forceps from the margins of the growth (to avoid central areas as these can be necrotic) A punch biopsy forceps is a long metallic instrument At one end there are sharp cutting edges to punch out biopsy from cervical growth
  • ➤ Whenever there is a cervical grwthm to confirm the diagnosis, a biopsy is taken using a punch biopsy forceps from the margins of the growth (to avoid central areas as these can be necrotic)
  • ➤ A punch biopsy forceps is a long metallic instrument
  • ➤ At one end there are sharp cutting edges to punch out biopsy from cervical growth
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 531, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology, 7 th edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 531, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology, 7 th edition

questions.text: Identify the following instrument:
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The image shown is that of a Hegar dilator.
  • ➤ Hegar dilator is a smooth solid rod of stainless steel, gently curved either on both sides The size of the dilator is decided by its diameter (ranges between 3mm to 12mm) They are available in graduated sets with increasing diameters of 0.5 mm or 1 mm

questions.text: All are advantages of the below given instrument except?

options.label: A
options.text: All the vaginal walls can be easily visualized

options.label: B
options.text: Its use does not require assistance

options.label: C
options.text: Several cervical and uterine procedures can be carried out

options.label: D
options.text: The groove allows drainage of secretions/ blood

questions.correct_answer: B. Its use does not require assistance
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Sims Speculum
  • ➤ Sims Speculum
  • ➤ Double bladed speculum Used to visualize the vaginal walls and cervix Used in several procedures including IUCD insertion, D & C and vaginal hysterectomies Advantages More space (compared to a Cuscos speculum) Better visualization of the vaginal walls The groove provides drainage of blood/ liquor/ secretions Disadvantages Not self retaining and hence requires assistance; used along with the anterior vaginal wall retractor
  • ➤ Double bladed speculum Used to visualize the vaginal walls and cervix Used in several procedures including IUCD insertion, D & C and vaginal hysterectomies

  • ➤ Advantages More space (compared to a Cuscos speculum) Better visualization of the vaginal walls The groove provides drainage of blood/ liquor/ secretions

  • ➤ More space (compared to a Cuscos speculum)
  • ➤ Better visualization of the vaginal walls
  • ➤ The groove provides drainage of blood/ liquor/ secretions
  • ➤ Disadvantages Not self retaining and hence requires assistance; used along with the anterior vaginal wall retractor
  • ➤ Not self retaining and hence requires assistance; used along with the anterior vaginal wall retractor
  • ➤ Not self retaining and hence requires assistance; used along with the anterior vaginal wall retractor
  • ➤ Cuscos Speculum
  • ➤ Cuscos Speculum
  • ➤ Bivalved, self-retaining speculum Used to visualize the cervix and in limited procedures (due to limited space) like taking a pap smear, IUCD insertion and removal. Advantages
  • ➤ Bivalved, self-retaining speculum
  • ➤ Used to visualize the cervix and in limited procedures (due to limited space) like taking a pap smear, IUCD insertion and removal.
  • ➤ Advantages
  • ➤ Self retaining so no assistance required
  • ➤ Self retaining so no assistance required
  • ➤ Disadvantages Limited space so limited procedures can be done Ant and post vaginal walls not visualized The lock may get spoiled if not taken care of
  • ➤ Disadvantages Limited space so limited procedures can be done Ant and post vaginal walls not visualized The lock may get spoiled if not taken care of

questions.text: A 35-year woman was planned to undergo a laparoscopic tubal ligation. The instrument shown below was used to create pneumoperitoneum. All are signs that carbon dioxide is in the peritoneal cavity except?

options.label: A
options.text: A drop of saline on the hub of the needle is sucked in if the needle is in the peritoneal cavity

options.label: B
options.text: On pushing saline, the fluid can’t be aspirated if it is in the peritoneal cavity

options.label: C
options.text: The pressure in the peritoneal cavity will be > 10 mmHg, if the needle is in the peritoneal cavity.

options.label: D
options.text: Obliteration of liver dullness if gas is intraperitoneal

questions.correct_answer: C. The pressure in the peritoneal cavity will be > 10 mmHg, if the needle is in the peritoneal cavity.
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ An important part of laparoscopic surgeries is creation of pneumoperitoneum The image shows a Verres needle which is used to create a pneumoperitoneum. It is typically inserted at the level of the umbilicus as there is no fat of muscle at this site. Palmer’s point is preferred if adhesions are anticipated. This point is 3 cm below the left costal margin in the mid-clavicular line. Intraperitoneal placement of the needle is confirmed by Drop test: place a drop of saline on the hub of the needle and life the abdominal wall; the drop is sucked in The insufflator will show a reading of intraperitoneal pressure < 10 mmHg (single digit reading) Push 5 ml of saline in the peritoneal cavity and then attempt to aspirate it. No fluid can be aspirated if the needle is in the peritoneal cavity. Liver dullness is obliterated if CO2 is flowing intra-peritoneally.
  • ➤ An important part of laparoscopic surgeries is creation of pneumoperitoneum
  • ➤ The image shows a Verres needle which is used to create a pneumoperitoneum.
  • ➤ It is typically inserted at the level of the umbilicus as there is no fat of muscle at this site.
  • ➤ Palmer’s point is preferred if adhesions are anticipated. This point is 3 cm below the left costal margin in the mid-clavicular line.
  • ➤ Intraperitoneal placement of the needle is confirmed by Drop test: place a drop of saline on the hub of the needle and life the abdominal wall; the drop is sucked in The insufflator will show a reading of intraperitoneal pressure < 10 mmHg (single digit reading) Push 5 ml of saline in the peritoneal cavity and then attempt to aspirate it. No fluid can be aspirated if the needle is in the peritoneal cavity. Liver dullness is obliterated if CO2 is flowing intra-peritoneally.
  • ➤ Drop test: place a drop of saline on the hub of the needle and life the abdominal wall; the drop is sucked in The insufflator will show a reading of intraperitoneal pressure < 10 mmHg (single digit reading) Push 5 ml of saline in the peritoneal cavity and then attempt to aspirate it. No fluid can be aspirated if the needle is in the peritoneal cavity. Liver dullness is obliterated if CO2 is flowing intra-peritoneally.
  • ➤ Drop test: place a drop of saline on the hub of the needle and life the abdominal wall; the drop is sucked in
  • ➤ The insufflator will show a reading of intraperitoneal pressure < 10 mmHg (single digit reading)
  • ➤ Push 5 ml of saline in the peritoneal cavity and then attempt to aspirate it. No fluid can be aspirated if the needle is in the peritoneal cavity.
  • ➤ Liver dullness is obliterated if CO2 is flowing intra-peritoneally.
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 273, Te Linde’s Operative Gynecology 11 th edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 273, Te Linde’s Operative Gynecology 11 th edition

questions.text: Identify this instrument:
A 45-year woman is undergoing a total laparoscopic hysterectomy for fibroid uterus. You notice the following equipment in the operation theater. What do the 3 markings show?

options.label: A
options.text: Intra-abdominal pressure, rate of gas flow and volume of gas used

options.label: B
options.text: Intra-abdominal pressure, rate of gas flow and light intensity

options.label: C
options.text: Rate of gas flow, volume of gas used and light intensity

options.label: D
options.text: Rate of gas flow, volume of gas remaining and light intensity

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ This is an image of an electronic gas insufflator The insufflator regulates the rate of inflow of gas to create/ maintain the intra-abdominal pressure. It shows 3 readings

  • ➤ The insufflator regulates the rate of inflow of gas to create/ maintain the intra-abdominal pressure.
  • ➤ It shows 3 readings
  • ➤ Intra-abdominal pressure Rate of gas flow Volume of gas used

  • ➤ Rate of gas flow

questions.text: A 42 year woman is undergoing an endometrial biopsy for abnormal uterine bleeding. You are assisting the resident for the procedure, and you are asked to hold the anterior lip of the cervix with the instrument shown below. What is the name of this instrument?
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ This is a vulsullum forceps Used to hold the anterior lip of the non-pregnant cervix prior to any procedure on the cervix/ uterus To sound the uterus and measure utero-cervical length To carry out procedures on the cervix like cervical biopsy, cervical dilatation, endocervical curettage To carry put procedure son the cervix like endometrial aspiration, polypectomy, IUCD insertion, MTP, HSG etc. To give traction to the cervix during vaginal hysterectomy Used to hold the posterior lip of the cervix during Culdocentesis (aspiration from pouch of Douglas; sometimes done in suspected ruptured ectopic) Examination for enterocele and rectocele

  • ➤ Used to hold the anterior lip of the non-pregnant cervix prior to any procedure on the cervix/ uterus To sound the uterus and measure utero-cervical length To carry out procedures on the cervix like cervical biopsy, cervical dilatation, endocervical curettage To carry put procedure son the cervix like endometrial aspiration, polypectomy, IUCD insertion, MTP, HSG etc. To give traction to the cervix during vaginal hysterectomy
  • ➤ To sound the uterus and measure utero-cervical length To carry out procedures on the cervix like cervical biopsy, cervical dilatation, endocervical curettage To carry put procedure son the cervix like endometrial aspiration, polypectomy, IUCD insertion, MTP, HSG etc. To give traction to the cervix during vaginal hysterectomy
  • ➤ To sound the uterus and measure utero-cervical length
  • ➤ To carry out procedures on the cervix like cervical biopsy, cervical dilatation, endocervical curettage
  • ➤ To carry put procedure son the cervix like endometrial aspiration, polypectomy, IUCD insertion, MTP, HSG etc.
  • ➤ To give traction to the cervix during vaginal hysterectomy
  • ➤ Used to hold the posterior lip of the cervix during Culdocentesis (aspiration from pouch of Douglas; sometimes done in suspected ruptured ectopic) Examination for enterocele and rectocele
  • ➤ Culdocentesis (aspiration from pouch of Douglas; sometimes done in suspected ruptured ectopic) Examination for enterocele and rectocele
  • ➤ Culdocentesis (aspiration from pouch of Douglas; sometimes done in suspected ruptured ectopic)
  • ➤ Examination for enterocele and rectocele

  • ➤ Ref: Page no 521, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology, 7 th edition

questions.text: The following instruments are required for an IUCD insertion except?
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Steps of IUCD insertion:
  • ➤ The posterior vaginal wall is retracted with Sim’s speculum and the anterior lip of cervix is held with the Vulsellum The cervix is cleaned with a betadine swab (on a sponge holding forceps) Uterine sound is introduced and the uterocervical length is measured. The horizontal limbs of the CuT are inserted into the inserter using a no-touch technique The tip of the plunger is placed in contact with the end of the vertical limb of the CuT The whole assembly is placed in the uterine cavity till the guard is in contact with the external os The plunger is stabilized, and the inserter is withdrawn to release the CuT and then both plunger and inserter are withdrawn together The threads are trimmed to about 1 inch from the external os with a suture cutting scissors.
  • ➤ The posterior vaginal wall is retracted with Sim’s speculum and the anterior lip of cervix is held with the Vulsellum
  • ➤ The cervix is cleaned with a betadine swab (on a sponge holding forceps)
  • ➤ Uterine sound is introduced and the uterocervical length is measured.
  • ➤ The horizontal limbs of the CuT are inserted into the inserter using a no-touch technique
  • ➤ The tip of the plunger is placed in contact with the end of the vertical limb of the CuT
  • ➤ The whole assembly is placed in the uterine cavity till the guard is in contact with the external os
  • ➤ The plunger is stabilized, and the inserter is withdrawn to release the CuT and then both plunger and inserter are withdrawn together
  • ➤ The threads are trimmed to about 1 inch from the external os with a suture cutting scissors.
  • ➤ Ref: https://nhm.gov.in/images/pdf/guidelines/nrhm-guidelines/family-planning/medical_officer.pdf
  • ➤ Ref:
  • ➤ https://nhm.gov.in/images/pdf/guidelines/nrhm-guidelines/family-planning/medical_officer.pdf

questions.text: Identify this instrument:
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ovum forceps has spoon shaped, blunt ends that come in close contact with each other when closed There is no catch on the handles so that any structure held inadvertently does not get crushed and traumatized but gets released when the instrument is drawn out. Indications Inevitable abortion to remove products of conception Incomplete abortion to remove products of conception Removal of foreign body from uterine cavity Uterine perforation is a complication

  • ➤ Indications Inevitable abortion to remove products of conception Incomplete abortion to remove products of conception Removal of foreign body from uterine cavity

questions.text: Identify the procedure being done in the image?

options.label: D
options.text: Large loop excision of the transformation zone

questions.correct_answer: D. Large loop excision of the transformation zone
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The image is of Large Loop excision of the transformation zone (LLETZ) or loop electrosurgical excision procedure This involves the removal of either the cervical lesion or the entire transformation zone using a thin, heated, stainless steel or tungsten wire loop electro-surgically. Indications Moderately severe to severe dysplasia (CIN II and CIN III) Other excisional methods for CIN II and CIN III include Cold knife conization Laser conization Needle excision of transformation zone
  • ➤ The image is of Large Loop excision of the transformation zone (LLETZ) or loop electrosurgical excision procedure
